alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton; Fayette; Howard; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 8:18AM CST until January 15 at 3:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Today Into Tonight... .A winter storm impacts Minnesota and Iowa today into tonight, with the greatest impacts towards the Interstate 35 corridor. Snow amounts steadily taper off from west to east through the region. In addition, east to northeast winds gusting up to 30 mph could cause patchy blowing and drifting snow, especially in open and unsheltered areas. If you have travel planned, be prepared for possible hazardous conditions, and consider altering or delaying your trip. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Light snow on top of any surfaces covered with ice from this morning`s freezing drizzle will make for especially slick conditions. * WHERE...Howard, Clayton, Allamakee, Winneshiek and Fayette Counties. * WHEN...The heaviest snow falls from late this morning through the afternoon, tapering off this evening. The precipitation should come to an end shortly after midnight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
